tooltip: Enter the email linked to your BikeFIT account. We’ll send the login code here.
Paste the 7‑character code from the email. Codes expire after a short time—request a new one if needed.
Vul het e-mailadres in dat aan je BikeFIT-account gekoppeld is. We sturen de inlogcode hiernaartoe.
Plak de 7-tekens code uit de e-mail. Werkt de code niet meer? Vraag dan een nieuwe aan.
Stand barefoot against a wall. Measure floor to top of head (cm). Used for initial frame-size and reach estimates (typical 130–210 cm).
Barefoot inseam: feet 10–15 cm apart, press a book firmly into the crotch, measure floor to book top (cm). Primary input for saddle height (typical 55–105 cm).
Measure from the top of your inseam reference (book) to the sternal notch (base of throat) while upright (cm). Improves reach and drop accuracy.
Arm extended horizontally: measure from shoulder bone (acromion) to center of clenched fist (cm). Refines cockpit length.
Measure bony shoulder width (acromion to acromion) in cm. Used to recommend handlebar width.
Seated with knee at 90°: measure from hip bone (greater trochanter) to center of kneecap (cm). Helps refine saddle setback.
A label for this bike (e.g., “Canyon Endurace 2023”). Helps you track multiple fits.
Select the exact type of bike you’re fitting. This changes posture targets and safety limits.
Vertical distance from BB center to top of head tube (mm). Found on the manufacturer geometry chart; determines handlebar height potential.
Horizontal distance from BB center to top of head tube (mm). Found on the manufacturer geometry chart; determines cockpit length baseline.
Angle of the seat tube (degrees). Use the manufacturer spec. Affects how far forward/back your saddle sits for the same saddle height.
Angle of the head tube (degrees). Use the manufacturer spec. Influences steering stability and trail.
Enter the size label used by the brand (e.g., 54, 56, M, L). If unsure, use stack/reach instead for best accuracy.
Measure from BB center to top of saddle along the seat tube line (mm). Use for comparing current vs. recommended fit.
Measure horizontal distance from BB center to saddle nose (mm). Positive values mean the saddle nose is behind the BB.
Length printed on the stem (mm), center‑to‑center. Used to compare your current cockpit with recommendations.
Angle printed on the stem (degrees). Affects handlebar height; note that flipping the stem changes the sign.
Width measured center‑to‑center at the hoods (mm). Typically matches shoulder width for comfort and control.
Length printed on the crank arm (mm). Used to adjust saddle height and hip/knee angles.
Enter a number only (no units). Use the specified unit in the label (cm/mm/deg).
Write a short, specific answer. Include relevant details like bike type, weekly volume, and any discomfort.
Enter the email linked to your BikeFIT account. We’ll send the login code here.
Your name, so we know how to address you.
Your email address, so we can reply.
Describe what you need help with (bike type, measurements, goals, and any pain/injuries).
Je naam, zodat we je netjes kunnen aanspreken.
Je e-mailadres, zodat we kunnen reageren.
Beschrijf kort je vraag (fietstype, metingen, doelen en eventuele klachten/blessures).
Barefoot inseam: feet 10–15 cm apart, press a book firmly into the crotch, measure floor to book top (cm). Primary input for saddle height (typical 55–105 cm).
Choose the category that matches your bike and intended use. This adjusts comfort vs. aerodynamics assumptions.
Pick your primary goal (comfort, endurance, race, TT/aero). The app will trade off stability, comfort, and aerodynamics accordingly.
Rate hamstring/hip flexibility: 1 = very limited (can’t touch toes), 3 = toes, 5 = palms on floor. Lower scores reduce handlebar drop and reach.
Rate core stability: 1 = <45s stable plank, 3 = ~60s, 5 = 90s+ controlled. Lower scores reduce aggressive reach/drop to protect the lower back.
